website_summaries.verdict: Reliable, easy to use gas chainsaw with great longevity — a perennial top pick from a leading brand.
pros: A powerful, effective, and well-constructed gas-powered chainsaw
This easy-starting "prosumer" model with automatic chain oiling swiftly cuts through large tree trunks and branches
cons: Chain brake must be disengaged when changing chain

website_summaries.verdict: Popular choice for non-professionals with occasional tree removal and trimming needs. We recommend investing in additional types of cutting chains for maximum performance.
pros: Lightweight but still has generous power
Good balance in hand and strong kickback resistance
cons: Oil leakage is a common user complaint
Replacement parts are hard to find
Oil and gas mixture must be precise

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Third Husqvarna saw. Bought this as replacement for ageing 460 and 142. This 455 is sufficient for cutting big trees but hard on the back for stripping limbs. Regarding Oil leaks - It only leaks if I store it leaving dust between the blade and the body. Then the oil siphons through the dust and drips out. It does not leak if you clean your saw after each use. I always disassemble the blade and blow out the saw after use - never had an issue since.
customer_reviews.author: Joern F

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Change the plug right away though.
customer_reviews.text: First thing...change out the plug and replace with a NGK and gap at .020. Sputtered and was really hard to restart after cutting a couple of times out of the box. Changed the plug. Runs like a striped ape. Restarts warm with out issue. A 2 stroke will require a new plug often. Get a 10 pack of plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Good to go!

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Rep was very dismissive and provided horrendous service.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw arrived defective. These things happen. Husqvarna support hung up on me twice before a very nice woman informed me that I need to have it fixed at a repair shop. I asked Amazon what to do and there service rep told me this is not his problem. If you get a defective item, you are on your own with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Domenic Luppino

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Michael
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model 455 which I have used for many years at my farm in North Florida. Hurricane Michael left us with many trees down which I had to clear to reopen access paths and trails and fix fences. I decided that I would need a back-up saw to assure continuous progress. My successes with my old saw convinced me that this was a good option. I prefer hard nose bars in this kind of work and immediately replaced the sprocket nose with a hard nose. Having that choice in the initial purchase would have been preferable. It worked fine out-of-the-box and continues to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: Broken on delivery
customer_reviews.text: Handle was broken out of the box. Seems to be very cheap plastic. Husqvarna’s only suggestion was to drive 30-40 miles to a dealer.
customer_reviews.author: douglas

customer_reviews.title: Second time it was used broke
customer_reviews.text: Second time I used this saw, it broke. Chain came off and looks like the transmission or something is burned up. Part of the gear mechanism is extremely hot. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and  easy to start
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about ordering this saw from Amazon because it was so much cheaper than the store. I was worried about getting a 2nd or refurbished saw. I am happy to say that I received a new in the box 455 with the better Farm Tough bar. This saw starts up easy, and cuts great. I am very happy with my purchase. I have already used this to cut probably 100 smaller trees, and it has never missed a beat. Also, this saw isn't super heavy for a 20" bar saw.
customer_reviews.author: Colt W. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Like Butter Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: This saw is excellent. Comes pre-assembled and chain tightened to specifications for first run. Gas and oil it up and you're ready to cut through any hardwood like butter. Does not seem to over-oil the bar and chain either. Starts with ease after a few pulls....be sure to use 89+ octane in the tank to prevent any knocking down the road. For my first run, I got through about 1 1/2 hours of fallen branches, small trees and light brush without so much as an issue. after this break-in run, I found that the chain had loosed and was in need of tension-tightening. Follow the directions for care that are in the manual and this saw should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A. Benington

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Have had Poulan saws in the past. Mostly use on lodgepole pine trees. Got some Ash and needed a bigger saw. My others were 34cc and 40cc. This being the 55cc and 20" bar has plenty of power, fired right up similar to my others. It came quickly enough, no shipping damage. I'll need a 10 hour break in before I use it too hard. Also no adjustments needed to carb at first even though I live at 9000'! After break in I may tweak it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: travel tools

customer_reviews.title: Airline would not accept as luggage.
customer_reviews.text: It's brand new but started at the manufacturer to test it, residual gas possible. TSA said it was fine but an Alaska Airline gal stuck her nose in the empty fuel area and barely smelled fumes. If I had kept this cap off a few hours or days and perhaps used a desiccant pouch it would not have had an oder and could have been checked. However it cost me a hell of a lot more money getting it to Alaska. They treat Alaska like we are Hawaii, we do have a road and the barge service here is way shorter than Hawaii. I barged a pool table, gun safe and snow plow saving thousands on shipping by truck.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cutting power while not weighing a ton for limbing as well as felling.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power! Starts every time cold or hot with one to three pulls. Has push pump primer and button to lessen compression for pull starting. Super smooth to operate with vibration system mounting and seems to be pretty heavy duty as it just survived a 22 foot high fall to the ground while limbing large pecan tree with zero damage and even continued to run.
customer_reviews.author: Capn Jack

customer_reviews.title: High quality saw.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw! Easy to use, cuts well even the large diameter. Good high quality blade. Was able to get a lot of wood processed for the winter. A neighbor is clearing 7 lots behind our house and gave us several trees. They were huge. A couple of days later we had a nice pile going, thanks to this saw. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Marina G

customer_reviews.title: Brand new.  Won't start.
customer_reviews.text: We went to use this for the first time. Their own video of how to start it calls it a simple process. You follow three steps. No matter what we have tried it will not start. One time it sounded like it was going to start, so we followed the instructions, nothing. Now it feels like zero resistance when you're pulling the starter cord. Unimpressed so far and we are beyond any return period. No idea what we will do from here.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen R.

customer_reviews.title: replacement for my 15 year old plus Husqvarna 55
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. As powerful as the old 55 but much user friendly. Felled an ash and cut up another ash today by the lake. Worked awesome. I have three Husqvarna's and they all are awesome machines. 445, 450 and now this 455. The old 55 will get some work done to it and gifted to a friend, still a fine machine in it's own right.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Lemon, 2 weeks beyond return window.
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw was a nightmare out of the box. We have years of experience with many saws including this model. Despite following the instructions to the letter, it was EXTREMELY difficult to start. It wouldn't stay running very long. We were using all the correct fuel and oils in the correct mixture. After less than an hour of use, the chain is binding so bad, it is completely useless. Since we had it for a little over a month before we used it, it is beyond the return window. Ours may just be a lemon but it is extremely frustrating. Make sure you check the return policy and use the machine right away.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Keep the Swedish trolls at bay
customer_reviews.text: This is the finest of Swedish chainsaws, designed for efficiently cutting Swedish trolls in half. I just tried it out this afternoon on some logs. It started super easy, idled great, and ran perfectly right out of the box. I'm going to use it to carve some halloween pumpkins in addition to the normal woodcutting chainsaw duties. It's even the same color as the pumpkins, for stealth pumpkin carving. It's a truly wonderful machine fit for a Viking.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Minniear

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I've taken down about 40 trees so far and cut up a lot of fallen trees, no issues. I am not worn out after several hours of operation and my hands don't buzz. Follow the directions on starting, and it reliably starts. One challenge I had was in changing out the chain, it is not as easy as the Maruyama saw I've used for 7 years. Again, follow the directions (I failed to disengage the chain break before removing the chain). As with all chainsaws, use ethanol-free fuel or recently purchased gas, do not use old gas or leave gas in the reservoir during storage.
customer_reviews.author: dwmccall

customer_reviews.title: Gas and Go
customer_reviews.text: Picked up this 455 to take over as my primary, and will keep my ~20yr old Husky 55 Rancher as my backup saw. I literally added bar oil and premix, and was on my way. Idles perfectly and jetted perfectly out of the box - gotta love that! Husky builds a good chainsaw ... just pay attention to your fuel and make sure you treat it or run ethanol-free premix for longevity, keep an eye on chain tension, and give it a good going over every few tanks of fuel and it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Foster Landberry

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: Put in the gas and oil, primed her, started on like the 5th pull. Regularly starts on the 2nd or third pull now when cold. Idles rock solid. This is my first "large" saw (by home owner saw standards) and everything is going great so far with a couple hours on her. Way more power than my smaller 35cc husky, and she cuts through 18" of rock hard elm without bogging.
customer_reviews.author: Fun lover

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good saw for limbing, cleaning up down wood and gathering and cutting firewood. Its a good all around saw for the money. Just read the manual there is a lot to know. It can be hard to start at times. Take the choke off if you have tried a few times and it has not started that usually works. Just so you know Amazon offers no product support and no returns on this product they just refer you to the manufacturer for repairs and service.
customer_reviews.author: Rob U

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power
customer_reviews.text: This is my second "Husky" chainsaw. First was a model 350. Very powerful and lightweight but eventually the motor shook the saw apart after 22 yrs of moderate usage. I'm cutting more wood now and although the 455 is a bit heavier it seems sturdier built for hard usage. I've logged 6 hours of continuous cutting with it so far and it seems like a well made saw. Starts easier than my previous saw too due to the primer bulb. Plenty of power going through large hardwood logs. Can't find anything wrong so far.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna beast!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a home owner and want a chainsaw that will start on the first pull, cut through logs and trees like butter then this is the saw for you. I have lots of 70-foot trees on my property and once or twice a year I lose a large branch or tree. My chainsaw has to work when I need it and this does unlike my previous Ryobi.
customer_reviews.author: Tony N

customer_reviews.title: Husband is happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband after countless complaints from him about his old chainsaw not starting, to hard to start, too difficult to use blah blah blah! He loves it! He said he finally found out what a real chainsaw is supposed to do. He said it starts right up, and cuts through anything! Maybe some work will get done!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Tomayko

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and not too pricey for what it can do
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful saw and able to handle any job a non professional would do. I cut wood for firewood for me and my father so I'm using it more than a casual user. It does the work for you as long as the chain is sharp. I think it's the last saw that I will need to buy. Skip the cheaper saws and buy a proven winner You won't regret it. Look at the YouTube videos on it. It's the truth
customer_reviews.author: malcolm b dixon

customer_reviews.title: sketchy
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived open and saw was dirty as if someone with oily hands was handling it. My guess is that was done at the factory but if that is the case then that is poor QA, oil and fuel bottles were also missing so was not able to start it as the one it is replacing is a Ryobi 40v electric. Will reach out to Husqvarna and update review.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime M

customer_reviews.title: cut very well!
customer_reviews.text: ordered on sat got it yesterday, went out tonight after work at a logging unit to some decked up alder, cut early summer. saw cut through 18 to 20 inch logs no problem not even a bog,primed 6 times choked it and on the 4th pull it fired right up, cleaned up in about 30 seconds and ran strong through 2 - 30' logs, so far so good restarted on first pull. i cut 5 to 6 cords a year and this saw should do the job well, time will tell. I also own a husky pole saw and weed eater, they all continue to run very well.
customer_reviews.author: pauline marie spalding

customer_reviews.title: Best chainsaw I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth chainsaw that I've purchased and it's the best of all four. It cranks easily, runs good, and cuts great. I cut down four 50'-60' trees yesterday. I cut off all the limbs and cut the trunks up into firewood-sized logs. The saw cut right through everything from beginning to end very easily. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: The saw is not ergonomically suited to me.
customer_reviews.text: The saw was received 10/14 and I decided to return this saw on 10/15. But was told the saw is not eligible for return. I don't understand since no oil or gas has been used yet. The saw is not ergonomically fit for by body and I have no reason to keep the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Sockwell

customer_reviews.title: Was delivered to front porch in Factory packaging
customer_reviews.text: Excited to use this but want to warn everyone that mine was delivered by Amazon to my front porch in the Factory Box for all to see. This should haver been mailed in a non-descript box like practically everything else I receive. If it hadn't been for my daughter being close by to get it since I was not, theres a good chance it wouldn't have been there when I got home. This needs to be fixed. That = minus 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Norton

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought a lot of wooded land, so I wanted a heavy duty chainsaw that would last. I am not disappointed in the quality of this tool, but I wish I had bought something lighter. Most of the trees and branches I am cutting are smaller than this unit requires, and holding it up and carrying gets tiring.
customer_reviews.author: jfmeredith

customer_reviews.title: Great quality saw, good price
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Lots of power. Easy to work on and maintain. Keep the chain sharp and you will have no trouble. The decompression button is great for cold starts. Starts in 2 pulls. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning Up After Hurricane Michael
customer_reviews.text: Nice chainsaw that starts fast and easy. With 90% of my 100+ trees, on 2 acres, on the ground, I will become "an expert". A reminder to others, read the manuals and think and act safely.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Goff

customer_reviews.title: Plastic spacers/washers
customer_reviews.text: My Rancher 455 has been great. I do want to give one piece of advise. For shipping there are 2 plastic washers/spacers. This is just to keep the cover from having issues when shipping without the bar on. These washers need to come off before putting the bar on. It could cause the chain to be loose or fall off. I add this because I didn’t find it in the instructions to remove the plastic spacers/washers but did talk to the local chainsaw repair guy.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Good strong saw
customer_reviews.text: Solid hard working chainsaw. I cut a lot of yellow poplar, cedar, black walnut, and oak stumps to prepare for stump grinding. This saw had tons is power. It’s heavy and not for a beginner (but a beginner could operate this with no problems.)
customer_reviews.author: JOBIN

customer_reviews.title: Not returnable / no support from Amazon except they'll give you a phone number period.
customer_reviews.text: First chainsaw I bought from Amazon, initially it started quick and it worked fine, but after cutting 1 medium sized tree....thereafter it lost power and it would cut very slow or if you applied pressure it slowed down / I am Very Disappointed and pissed that AMAZON could not help me other than give me a Husqvarna phone number / all I asked was for a replacement and not a refund, this happened within 8 days of receiving this item.....this is within 30 days?. Amazon sells chainsaws but takes no responsibility in anything.
customer_reviews.author: arturo banuelos

customer_reviews.title: Solid workhorse of a chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: The model 455 is one that every homeowner should have on hand. This is by far the best chain saw i have owned, I purchased the 20 inch bar and put it to work the day after it arrived. I took down two dead trees and had the wood stacked in about 90 minutes. I am 100% satisfied with the model 455, strong motor, solid construction, straight forward starting and easy to maintain / adjust during use.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Wisner

customer_reviews.title: works simple and good
customer_reviews.text: We had a dump of about 15 logs of all sizes; fir, cedar and alder. Some seasoned some very green and heavy. Needed a new chain saw. My son-in-law, a former lumberjack on the Olympic Peninsula, recommended this one. It's important to read the manual particularly about bar oil, fuel mix, starting procedures and, of course, safety. Not rocket science. After that the logs were nice-size rounds in about 3 hours and some help to move the big ones. So far this product is well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: John Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome power, chain was super sharp and made quick work of the old blown over oak tree. The only complaint I'd have would be size and bulk, but this is a serious chainsaw and I feel that's expected for the performance you get. It might be a little much for the average home owner.
customer_reviews.author: James Moore

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality bar
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 455 rancher new at Amazon. It is relatively easy to start and runs well, though not as powerful as my prior one. Have used it fewer that half a dozen times over the 6 weeks I have owned it and the metallic coating on the bar is already peeling off. Would return it for replacement if I could, but amazon seems to have shortened warranty periods.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: Well Constructed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for a family member. He had done his research and wanted this 455 Rancher. He uses it to cut up firewood to help heat his house. He absolutely has had no problems and said he would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: nancy j

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I've cut trees and logs up to 19 inch and it has no problem. Not the best for cleaning the branches off as it is a fairly heavy saw but I've spent 4 to 5 hours knocking trees down and processing them with just this saw, it didn't kill me.
customer_reviews.author: Rjacobs

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a great saw for the price. Definitely not underpowered. Had been using a 440 to clear debris after the hurricane and while it is a good saw, it just doesn't have the reach, weight, or torque of the 455. The pace of work definitely picked up with the Rancher.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: The only chainsaw better would be a Stihl but at a greater cost
customer_reviews.text: Having used a Husqvarna Rancher 455 for over ten years, I had no qualms about purchasing another as a gift to my son. He loves it. It is a bit lighter than my aged one but that is to be expected given how technology advances.
customer_reviews.author: K Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable and powerful saw
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts right through logs with no issues at all. Just make sure you keep your blade sharp. This is my second season using this saw and I have cut a total of 17 trees down and I am impressed how powerful and reliable it is. Just make sure to hit the throttle and trigger quick once you start it to put it into idle mode or it will not run right (chain brake must be engaged). A lot of people might not know that. Just use the dogs when cutting that come with your chainsaw and its easy cutting. I through an 18" diameter tree with ease. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Totally pissed.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this USED chainsaw when I payed for a new unopened one. The tank smells of gas there's oil smudges on the handle and I'm roually pissed. This is unacceptable so I'm gonna try and return this and depending how it goes I'll give this product 5 stars but for now just 1
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.  Broke after cutting down one tree.
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism that holds the chain and clutch broke after only a couple days of use. Saw is useless without it. I was very surprised that this product was rated well. It is very poorly made. Also, it states that it starts easily, however, I would say that it takes an average of 25 pulls and playing with the choke to get it running. I hardly write reviews. Don't buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an older husky. The saw is a little heavy but if you have some big wood to drop I wouldn’t want anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Oak trees don’t stand a chance
customer_reviews.text: Man, I just got the 455, put some oil and gas in it, primed it and pulled the cord, boom started right up, first pull. Unreal. I went to work immediately and cut a bunch of oak trees, infected with oak wilt. It took no time to cut through 12” tree trunks and the 56cc makes it feel like butter. I must say after an hour I felt the weight of it. Turning the saw and cutting small branches is a bit harder than with my 440, but man so far so good. Let’s see how it holds up over time. I’ll report back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Best saw I’ve ever purchased. Not kidding, the thing started in the first pull. Enough power to go through large trees with an ease. Use premixed gas. Works great. Slightly heavier than what I used before but it is a 55.5 cc. I had a 42cc before this.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Gato

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and cuts easily.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister in-law to help with cleanup after hurricane Michael devastated the area. All she reported was it cuts a tree like butter and it taking care of the tree clearing quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Runs through a 18 inch tree like butter.
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw, realitively easy to use, runs about an hour before needing more fuel and oil. The balence on it seems to be a little off but nothing that you can't compensate for.
customer_reviews.author: Orellum

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great Chainsaw. I cut about 3-4 cords of wood so far. Mostly Oak & Ash.15"-24" diameter. This saw cut it with ease. Starts easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: Starts, Runs and Cuts Great!
customer_reviews.text: It came assembled, I added chain oil and fuel mix, primed it and it started the first pull... I let it run at lower speeds and revved it enough to spin the chain to spread and fully lube the chain for about five minutes then started cutting wood keeping the revs down to break it in.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy cranking. Works perfectly for what I bought it ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this chainsaw to do Post-Irma clean-up of numerous large trees that I lost around the yard. Easy cranking. Works perfectly for what I bought it for. Very pleased with this Husqvarna 455. Fast 2-day shipping through PRIME
customer_reviews.author: TWS

customer_reviews.title: replaced my useless Stihl.
customer_reviews.text: Got this saw last week..replaced my useless Stihl...which lasted four months....junk...The Husky was everything everyone said...started after 2 pulls and has every time since. Gonna love working with this on our farm. Gonna replace my smaller Stohl with a 14 inch Husky. The Stihl is always a pain to start.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O. Basler

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money - Irma clean up
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this saw after Irma hit us here in Florida. I cleaned up a large, 80 ft maple that came down in my yard and three more trees at my neighbors. This chainsaw is a beast and easy for novice tree fallers. I watched about an hour of tutorial videos and reviews and decided this saw was the best for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Our Simple Story

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw
customer_reviews.text: Buying this impressed my son-in-law. Not easy thing to do. Most used after hurricanes in So. Fla. Does the trick on mostly soft wood trees so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis F. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw works awesome! Just be sure you keep the blade sharp and use high octane gas.
customer_reviews.author: Hicks D.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well after it starts
customer_reviews.text: Good saw, easy to handle. But it is HARD to start. Altitude maybe, I've been using it at 8400 feet, so might need some fuel system adjustment. Update about hard to start. Very small adjustment of the "T" screw and it starts right up. As it says in the manual (should've read it closer) the saw comes from the factory set at sea level.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: I love my Husqvarna - it's almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw is light and performs well, year over year. My only ding on it is; if your chain comes off-be prepared to throw it away. The chain bends because it hangs up on a saftey gaurd, on the bottom of the saw. I'm not the design engineer, so I'm not sure why they needed it, but I know that 2 out of 5 times the chain falls off - it will catch and bend the chain (so it's throw away). It's made me a better monitor of the chain tension, so maybe that's the saftey factor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw took out of the box gassed it up put oil in it and it fired up 4th pull. Cuts hardwood like butter plenty of power you can't go wrong with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: mrtdrew

customer_reviews.title: Very bummed
customer_reviews.text: It seems like this chain saw would cut really well if it was working properly. However the first one I ordered , the trigger didn't work so i couldn't get it to work at all. So I was sent another one (which was great) but that one the oiler doesn't work. I am very bummed that I bought a brand new chain saw and now have to go get it fixed
customer_reviews.author: Koa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be fixed, but got a refund
customer_reviews.text: Saw will not idle, stuck spinning non stop. Throttle doesn't seem to do anything either or just won't work if saw isn't idle. Unable to cut anything. We are going to see if we can get it fixed or adjusted, but it did not work on our very first attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great chain saw for residential use
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power for residential jobs. I purchased this for my dad for Christmas and have used it with him a few times already. He loves the saw and uses it to clean up the land he owns.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Dunning

customer_reviews.title: I love this brand!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and needed. The Husqvarna brand always starts as it should and doesn't let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Zabelin

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked, set up, and went straight to the trees. No problems at all with the start up, or felling trees with this saw. It tackled the job with much vigor and power. So far, so good .
customer_reviews.author: James L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Husky 455 Rancher 20" nice little saw.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting great right out of the box. Shut off button seems slightly misaligned, but functions. Seems like a nice saw.
customer_reviews.author: LNEIII

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all. Starts great. Runs great. Powerful. A little heavy for trimming, but good for logs and trees. I have also only been using premixed fuel.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Very happy
customer_reviews.text: fantastic, cant say enough good about it. It was shipped fast and was easy to assemble. Put it right to work cutting firewood and was impressed with the power.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Joseph

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE they ship Refurbished / Used chainsaws as "New"
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw shipped by Amazon was not new and missing the bottle of pre-mix fuel. The tank smells gas and muffler has black spots on it. I ordered a new one, and I received a used/refurbished one
customer_reviews.author: Mouss Mamouni

customer_reviews.title: Durable - Easy to start
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gas saw I have owned. It is very easy to start and cuts through hard wood easily. LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Gorney

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly and works great. Been using it for 4-5 weeks now. It start quickly and cuts fast.
customer_reviews.author: CoPj

customer_reviews.title: totaly unreliable
customer_reviews.text: the worst saw I have ever purchased...will not crank 99% of the time. The only reason I gave it one star is because there was no minus 10
customer_reviews.author: W J Baker II

customer_reviews.title: Great Chain Saw!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Great size, great weight and awesome power, might get too hot if on a professional job but so far so good!!
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: the 455 comes out and takes care of them like budder. This saw exceeded all expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a big-boy saw. I have a Stihl 025 w/18" bar that is still (pun intended) my go-to saw. But when the big logs present, the 455 comes out and takes care of them like budder. This saw exceeded all expectations. It rocks. Truly.
customer_reviews.author: SteveCo

customer_reviews.title: Built for premature failure
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I purchased this saw was because it was “consumer reports best value”. It is anything but. Worked well at first, now struggles under load. Always use a “ratio rite” and either SeaFoam or Startron when mixing fuel. The spark plug and air filter aren’t even dirty yet and I’ve only run a file over the chain maybe 10 times so it’s barely used. Major disappointment, total junk....
customer_reviews.author: Hwy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Reliable & Powerful Product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a awesome purchase lots of power reliable and I would recommend to anyone serious about buying a saw to get some serious work done
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One bad a** saw, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through anything I've put it up against like butter. Unless the tree pinches down\ falls on it this thing does not bog down. The best Investment Ive made since buying property.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid reliable saw.
customer_reviews.text: Having owned mine for two years I can now access it's qualities. Although a bit heavy for homeowner use, this thing goes through wood like a snow plow. It is very ergonomic, balanced, and powerful. It starts very quick even if it has not been used in a while which is very nice. Keep fresh fuel in it and it will not let you down. I rarely have to tighten the chain as it seems to stay taut better than my old Poulan saw.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible to start
customer_reviews.text: Starting this saw is more work than any of the cutting I’ve done with it. I’ve had it to two different shops to adjust for altitude but no luck. Now it only idles for a few minutes before quitting. Buy something else especially if you at a higher elevation.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Durable saw! Easy to start!
customer_reviews.text: Came with chain/bar cover -but no carrying case for the saw-this is sold separately
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good product! Easy cranking
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift to my fiance', he says it handles well, no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Hudson

customer_reviews.title: now thats a saw
customer_reviews.text: Nice easy start. Lots of power. Another thing I should have owned years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Rey

customer_reviews.title: Returned my borrowed Husky and got this one to replace it. It's even better than the first Husky.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Husky chainsaws and this is even better. Easier to access chain adjustment, thicker chain than the last Husky I had and always starts on 2nd pull.
customer_reviews.author: Bart D. Hull

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: This saw exceeded my expectations. I have had a a rancher 44 16” saw since 1983 it has been very reliable and loved it... I bought the 450 to help a friend clear some property and it was amazing he had a 2 other saws and this cut circles around them... just wish I could go cut more that is one thing I enjoy... I would highly recommend this saw ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tree eater
customer_reviews.text: Got here quicker then it was supposed to. If Stihl is the Benz of saws, this is the BMW.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Animal
customer_reviews.text: This saw is an animal! I have an old Stihl 028 Wood Boss. This think is crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Rino

customer_reviews.title: just because its new. it can have problems.
customer_reviews.text: great saw ive used saws my whole life. the only problem with this saw was it would not put oil on the bar it would leak oil out the bottom. I took it a part and found that when they put it togesther, they did not get the oil tube in place under the pump. once fixed it works great.
customer_reviews.author: mr.firewood

customer_reviews.title: Arrived useless
customer_reviews.text: Received in beat up box with no chain saw nor the fuel mix. No returns so I hope they make it good soon. Bought it as a gift to hub, so sorry it was anticlimactic bc he cant do anything with it until we receive a chain.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S. Riggins

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw, can be hard to start
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice saw, but it can be very hard to start when it's cold. Once it's warmed up it starts easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Don't compromise, get the best!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a machine! Add extra man points to your card an get this beast. It goes through trees like a hot knife through butter. Took it out of box, added oil/fuel, followed start up directions and it cranked up in less than 30 seconds. It will be the last chainsaw you'll ever buy of you take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Package had been opened, and there was slight damage, but chainsaw seems to start ok.
customer_reviews.text: Item was supposed to be new, but manufacturer's box had been opened and resealed. Retainer had been popped off. We think we've got it fixed, but time will tell. It started ok, but we haven't cut any logs with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: Junk Product with No Support
customer_reviews.text: Received and did not work. Replaced spark plug, etc. and still would not start. This is junk. Borrowed my friends Stihl and it fired right up!!! Called customer service and no help at all, actually said “may need to be tuned to my region 🤪. Would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: P S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best chainsaw I've ever owned. Starts every time and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ed G

customer_reviews.title: Smooth sawing!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! Firewood gathering has been a breeze! thru quickie like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super chain saw. I needed it for downed trees and limbs after recent hurricane.
customer_reviews.author: Oakley

customer_reviews.title: This saw has a plastic crankcase !!
customer_reviews.text: Great saw so far starts and runs great the only issue I had with it was missing the "o"-ring on the oil cap has good power ,I cut a 24" log no problem
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: It starts in the cold
customer_reviews.text: This is a good saw, it can be very cold and it will start without problem. The power is good for what it is used for. The bar is a good length and matched to the saw's power. I will buy it again if another saw of this size is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting power
customer_reviews.text: The 455 Rancher made short work of 8 dead pines just before a hurricane . Keep the chain sharp and adjusted on the bar , oil on the right setting. It goes back to one simple rule ( Use the right tool for the job ) and the Husqvarna 455 20 in is the right tool for the job if you want to get-r-done !
customer_reviews.author: Southmoon

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied I ordered this saw on September 18th and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied I ordered this saw on September 18th and it arrived on the 22nd all the way from North Dakota to Miami. After adding fuel and bar oil it fired right up without hesitation. Now we can remove the enormous oak tree that hurricane Irma blew over.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Mercugliano

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 20 Inch 455 Rancher Gas Chainsaw
product_meta.description:
Style:20 in.| Pattern Name:ChainsawThe ergonomic design of The Husqvarna 20" 455 Rancher gas chainsaw allows the homeowner to handle the power of the saw with ease. Powerful, yet easy to start thanks to smart start technology, This gas powered chainsaw is ready to cut trees, whether you need to prune, limb or cut firewood. The air injection centrifugal air cleaning system helps keep larger dust & debris particles from reaching the air filter, to improve engine life. The love anti-vibration system reduces vibration levels, for more comfortable chainsaw operation. Maximum power speed: 9000 rpm.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The 455 Rancher is an ideal saw for landowners and part-time users who require a high powered, heavy-duty and responsive workmate for all cutting conditions. It combines the best characteristics of its predecessor with new, facilitating technology and ergonomics.
feature_bullets: 455 Rancher chainsaw is an ideal saw for landowners or homeowners who require a high powered and heavy duty chainsaw
55. 5cc 20 inch gas chainsaw with guide bar and chain
2 cycle engine with Intertie activated chain brake for safety while operating
Comes with Husqvarna chainsaw Bar cover and 2. 6 ounce bottle of pre-mix fuel Included, Bar and chain oil must be purchased Separately
Automatic chain oiler delivers a steady supply of bar and chain oil for safe and effective use
Simple, side-mounted chain tensioning system allows for quick chain adjustments while working
The quick-release air filter facilitates easy cleaning and replacement of the air filter
Husqvarna chainsaw with x-torque lowers fuel consumption and reduces emissions
For safety use with Husqvarna chainsaw chaps, chainsaw gloves and chainsaw helmet
Replacement chainsaw chain, chainsaw case and chainsaw sharpener are available as separate purchases

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars700 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
